cont.entity_a: Significantly improved the quality of photos when transitioning from JPEG/automatic to RAW/manual settings. Pictures are sharper than other lenses. Slightly soft at the edges when wide open, but generally offers good image quality.
cont.entity_b: Sharper than the 28mm. Tack sharp at all apertures. Produces amazing pictures, especially indoors. Sharp from f/2.8.

cont.entity_a: Autofocus is not supported on the Nikon D5600; requires an AF-S lens for autofocus. Slightly slower autofocus due to reliance on the camera motor.
cont.entity_b: Silent and smooth autofocus. Fast and accurate autofocus.

cont.entity_a: Lightweight and mostly plastic construction; feels fragile but can last if handled carefully. Poor build quality with loose tolerances.
Not compatible with Nikon D3400; requires the 1.8G lens.

Manual Focus.comm: Manual focus is required for cameras without an internal focus motor.

cont.entity_a: Takes incredibly sharp photographs and requires manual focus on DX cameras without a focusing motor.
Wide aperture and fast focus, suitable for indoor and outdoor photography.
cont.entity_b: The lens is very effective in low light, often eliminating the need for a flash. Fast aperture for low light photography.

cont.entity_a: Great bokeh. Sharp photos with a beautiful bokeh effect; ideal for portraits and low light.
Performs better on crop sensor cameras than on full frame, especially at higher aperture settings.
cont.entity_b: Wide angle is perfect for architecture, landscape, and family shots. A good walk-around prime lens.

cont.entity_a: The lens can fit loosely and show an EE error.
